chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw or Discharge Bodily Fluids at Public Safety Worker

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha N. Roby

records.addlTxt: Plea questionnaire waiver of rights form
DAGP agreement

1:30 pm case called. Defendant Samantha N. Roby in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion in court for Samantha N. Roby.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1 as charged in the Information. Court accepts plea and withholds a finding of Guilt. 
A 12 month DAGP is accepted and filed with the court.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 12, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 12, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 3:28 PM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Samantha N. Roby in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Samantha N. Roby.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sebion requests a short adjournment so the Defendant can meet with the DAGP Coordinator.
STC: 9/12/22 at 1:30 PM.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Case called at 8:59 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Samantha Roby appears in person. Attorney Carly Sebion appears by video for Defendant. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, and enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. Defendant updates phone number. 
Status Conference: 07/07/2022 at 3:30 PM (Zoom approved).
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Samantha N. Roby in court.  Attorney Carly Sebion in court for Samantha N. Roby.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties are ready to proceed. 

State calls Officer Joel Field, City of Altoona Police Department to the stand; is sworn and testifies. Witness identifies defendant. Cross examination by Defense. Witness is excused.

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. This is a Br. 3 case and is referred there for further scheduling.
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Case called at 9:39 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney DA Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samantha N. Roby in court.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Samantha N. Roby. 
Defense indicates there is no agreement- requests Prelim be scheduled. 
Preliminary Hearing: 04/19/2022 at 1:30 PM.
Dated 02/25/2022, from State Public Defender Office to Eau Claire County Judges regarding Zoom appearances for out-of-county attorney appointments

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:22 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Samantha Roby appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Complaint. Defendant updates phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/09/2022 at 2:45 PM.  Hearing: 04/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.
